snippet: President Mohamed Morsi’s decree appeared to be a bold effort to claim authority, raising the specter of confrontation with Egypt’s military and courts.
abstract: President Mohamed Morsi of Egypt unexpectedly orders the country’s Islamist-led Parliament to reconvene, challenging an earlier decision by Egypt’s most powerful generals and judges to dissolve the legislative body; decree appears to be a bold effort to claim authority for his 10-day-old presidency, and it raises the specter of a new confrontation between the president and his Islamist supporters on the one hand, and the military council and Egypt’s highest court on the other.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and MAYY EL SHEIKH
byline.contributor: David D. Kirkpatrick contributed reporting from Cairo, and Scott Shane from Washington.

lead_paragraph: President Mohamed Morsi’s decree appeared to be a bold effort to claim authority, raising the specter of confrontation with Egypt’s military and courts.

headline.seo: Egypt’s New President Orders Parliament Back
headline.main: Egypt’s President Orders Return of Parliament
headline.print_headline: Egypt President Orders Return Of Parliament
